question.content: The widening set of interdependent relationships among people from different parts of the world is known as ________.
In terms of international business, it is most accurate to say that ________.

option1.content: there is a universal "best way" to conduct business

option2.content: global competition affects large companies but not small ones

option3.content: most firms depend either on foreign markets and supplies or compete against companies that do

option4.content: government regulation of international business has little effect on a company’ s profits

question.content: Devon, an accounts manager at a large electronics firm, does not have any direct international responsibilities; however, Devon would most likely benefit from studying international business issues so that he can ________.

option2.content: better understand how foreign operations affect the company’ s competitive position

option3.content: supervise and evaluate subordinates who have global assignments

option4.content: understand the legalities of importing and exporting products overseas

question.content: The shifting of national borders has most likely created which of the following situations for international business?

option1.content: It has left rural residents more isolated from technology.

option2.content: It has complicated the understanding of behavioral factors affecting business.

option3.content: It has increased physical barriers to exporting.

option4.content: It has slowed communications between a company’ s headquarters and foreign operations.

question.content: Which of the following is an indication of the increased globalization of business since the end of World War II?

option1.content: Foreign trade has largely replaced foreign ownership as a means of conducting international business.

option2.content: World trade has grown more rapidly than world production.

option3.content: Globally, consumers now depend on foreign output for more than half their consumption.

option4.content: Countries have increased their import restrictions to counter the rising tide of imports.

question.content: Most of the world’ s goods and services are sold ________.

option2.content: in the countries where they are produced

question.content: According to the A.T. Kearny/Foreign Policy Globalization Index, countries ________.

option1.content: tend to be ranked similarly on all four dimensions

option2.content: are more globalized on the political dimension than on personal contact

option3.content: that are large in land mass and population are less globalized than small countries

option4.content: sometimes rank high on one dimension and low on another

question.content: Which of the following has NOT been a major force increasing globalization in recent decades?

option2.content: increase in and expansion of technology

question.content: Imported flowers are now a stronger competitor to U.S. grown flowers in the U.S. market. Which of the following is likely the MOST important factor for this increase in imports?
A company starting out with a global focus, usually because of the international experience of its founders, is called a ________.
In a strategy known as ________, many new companies locate themselves near competitors and suppliers.
The process of shifting production from a domestic to a foreign location is best known as ________.
Visible exports and imports are ________.

option2.content: the sum total of goods and services traded

option3.content: international transactions paid for in money rather than barter

option4.content: typically a country’ s least common international economic transactions

question.content: Which term refers to two or more companies that share ownership of an FDI?
A multinational enterprise (MNE) is best defined as a firm ________.

option1.content: that is a member of the Fortune 500

question.content: The term used by the United Nations as a synonym for multinational enterprise is ________.
Politics, law, culture, and economy are all examples of ________ factors that can affect the ways in which companies produce and sell their products in foreign markets.
Managers who are knowledgeable about ________ are better able to identify the location, quantity, quality, and availability of the world’ s natural resources.
Some key ________ factors in a company’ s international business external environment are its product strategy and access to resources.
________ integration is the political and economic agreements among countries that give preference to member countries to the agreement.
Country A and Country B make an agreement to cooperate more closely and implement tariff reductions. Which of the following best describes this agreement?
Global integration occurs as countries from all over the world decide to cooperate through the ________.
The ________ clause embodied the fundamental principle of GATT–-trade without discrimination.
The goal of a ________ is to abolish all tariffs among member countries.
A ________ results when free mobility of factors of production is added to a customs union.
Members of the Andean Community (CAN) have a common external tariff. CAN is most likely a ________.
________ effects of trade agreements are the shifting of resources from inefficient to efficient companies as trade barriers fall.

________ effects of economic integration are the overall growth in the market and the impact on a company caused by expanding production and by the company’ s ability to achieve greater economies of scale.
A(n) ________ is the price of a currency.
________ involve the exchange of currency the second day after the date on which the two foreign-exchange traders agree to the transaction.
In which of the following transactions is one currency swapped for another on one date and then swapped back on a future date?

A foreign-exchange contract that is an agreement between two parties to buy or sell a particular currency at a particular price at a particular date in the future as specified in a standardized contract to all participants in the specified market is known as a(n) ________.
The top location for trading foreign exchange is ________.
In the spot market, the ________ is the difference between the bid and offer rates and is the trader’ s profit margin.
Which of the following is the price at which the trader is willing to sell foreign currency?
A(n) ________ is the right but not the obligation to buy or sell a foreign currency within a certain time period or on a specific date at a specific exchange rate.
All of the following are part of the global financial system except the ________.
The degree to which a firm funds the growth of a business by debt is known as ________.
What term refers to a currency on deposit outside its country of issue?
On the basis of which interest rate are Euroloans often quoted?
Which of the following best explains why international business has grown rapidly in the past few decades?

option1.content: the end of the political division between the Communist and non-Communist blocs

option2.content: greater income equality in most countries

question.content: Which of the following has MOST influenced consumers to demand access to foreign-made products?

option1.content: Declining global affluence has caused consumers to seek out lower-priced products from abroad.

option2.content: Consumers have become more efficient in using media and technologies to compare prices worldwide.

option3.content: Fearing that their governments will enact restrictive policies on imports, consumers are stocking up on foreign products before restrictions are put in place.

option4.content: Expectations of rising prices of foreign products have caused consumers to seek foreign products before their prices become prohibitive.

question.content: Which of the following best defines international business?

option1.content: It includes all economic flows between two or more countries.

option2.content: It includes all private economic flows between two or more countries.

option3.content: It includes all business transactions involving two or more countries.

option4.content: It includes all business transactions in countries other than your home country.

question.content: Carnival Cruise Lines lowers its taxes by all of the following EXCEPT ________.

option1.content: hiring host-country nationals who pay no taxes

option2.content: taking advantage of taxation laws in foreign countries

option3.content: sailing in international waters outside countries’{} tax jurisdiction

option4.content: paying substantial port fees instead of taxes during stopovers

question.content: A flag of convenience is ________.

option1.content: the declaration that a product is made in a country that has easier legal access to a given foreign market

option2.content: a designation for products originating within a particular trading group

option3.content: the registration of a ship by a shipping company in a country that charges low taxes

option4.content: the indication that a shipping organization can sail in international waters

question.content: The owner of a U.S. football team and the owner of a Canadian hockey team purchase a British soccer team. This is an example of a ________.
When companies face the same competitors in almost all countries where they operate, ________.

option1.content: what they learn about each other in one country is useful in predicting the other’ s strategies and actions elsewhere

option2.content: the market leader is the same everywhere

option3.content: there is less need to understand the physical and societal factors of each country

option4.content: they are less likely to enter joint ventures with other companies

question.content: Although the U.S. film industry depends heavily on revenue in foreign countries, revenue from international markets is usually low for a sports-themed film. This is most likely due to ________ factors.
In addition to understanding the laws affecting business in countries where their companies operate, it is most important for managers to understand the ________.

option3.content: history of the local legal system

question.content: An example of a Japanese service export is a visit by a ________.

option1.content: Japanese citizen to Disneyland in the United States

option2.content: Japanese citizen to the Japan Pavilion at Epcot Center in the United States

option3.content: U.S. citizen to the Japan Pavilion at Epcot Center in the United States

option4.content: U.S. citizen to Tokyo Disneyland in Japan

question.content: Reebok pays a royalty to the German Soccer League to use the team’ s logo on t-shirts that it sells. Reebok and the German Soccer League most likely have a ________.
A foreign direct investment occurs when ________.

option1.content: a company owns at least 25% of a foreign firm

option2.content: a company has a controlling interest in a foreign company

option3.content: foreign ownership is in private rather than government securities

option4.content: a foreign firm agrees to a licensing agreement with a large conglomerate

question.content: Which of the following BEST explains how a firm reduces risk by operating internationally?

option1.content: taking advantage of business-cycle differences among countries

option2.content: buying competitive risk insurance unavailable domestically

option3.content: preventing competitors from operating in the countries it has entered

option4.content: operating in less competitive environments than those at home

question.content: An example of a U.S. merchandise import is an automobile made in ________ and sold ________.

option1.content: the United States by a Japanese company; in the United States

option2.content: the United States by a Japanese company; outside the United States

option3.content: Japan by a Japanese company; in the United States

option4.content: Japan by a U.S. company; outside the United States

question.content: Kevin, marketing manager of the North American Bowling League, has decided to televise major bowling competitions to viewers in multiple countries rather than only in Canada and the U.S. Which of the following goals would this most likely help Kevin accomplish?
A firm is currently seeking resources from foreign countries. Which of the following is the LEAST likely reason for doing so?

option1.content: manufacturing products at a lower cost

option2.content: gaining knowledge about a specific market

option3.content: following a customer into the global market

option4.content: differentiating its products from the competition

question.content: A major criticism of offshoring is that it ________.

option2.content: exchanges good jobs for bad jobs

option3.content: threatens the sovereignty of larger countries

option4.content: allows companies to avoid payment of any taxes

question.content: Critics of offshoring claim all EXCEPT which of the following?

option1.content: Cost savings are seldom passed on to final consumers.

option2.content: Offshoring reduces the incomes of people in low-wage countries.

option3.content: Incomes of workers in countries whose companies offshored production have gone down as a percentage of national income.

option4.content: Many workers who have been displaced by offshoring do not have the skills needed for higher-value jobs.

question.content: Which of the following is NOT one of the three main reasons affecting international business for governments to cooperate with each other?

option1.content: to attack problems jointly that one country acting alone cannot solve

option2.content: to deal with issues that lie outside the territory of any nation

question.content: Governments have signed treaties to protect foreign-owned property rights, such as investments and patents. A primary reason for doing so is to ________.

option2.content: reduce the domestic effects of other countries’{} economic policies

option3.content: deal with areas of concern outside the territory of any one country

option4.content: reduce national conflicts leading to violent political demonstrations

question.content: All of the following are areas in which commercial activities take place outside the territory of any nation EXCEPT ________.
What is the most likely reason that governments cooperate with each other through treaties, agreements, and consultations?

option1.content: to gain an advantageous division of labor

option2.content: to be in compliance with United Nations’{} requirements

option3.content: to attack problems jointly that one country acting alone cannot solve

option4.content: to assure that all countries get an equitable share of taxes from multinational enterprises

question.content: When a company successfully responds to foreign production and market opportunities, ________.

option1.content: other companies will likely emulate its successful practices

option2.content: it likely has a long-term advantage over competitors

option3.content: it will downsize its domestic operations

option4.content: its home government likely raises taxes on the company

question.content: Global Positioning Solutions Inc. is a Utah-based company that ________.

option1.content: provides location assistance for global executives who travel frequently

option2.content: is a division of a banking syndicate in the Western part of the United States

option3.content: assists firms that have foreign-exchange needs but that lack in-house foreign-exchange teams

option4.content: started out by providing foreign exchange services that were not being offered by commercial banks

question.content: A major challenge to Global Positioning Systems in providing foreign-exchange services to its clients is that ________.

option1.content: GPS lacks access to major foreign exchange quoting services

option2.content: GPS has to constantly upgrade the quality of the services it offers

option3.content: GPS cannot provide individualized attention to its customers, so it has to commoditize its product lines

option4.content: new regulations have stopped GPS from selling foreign-exchange services that compete with the banks

question.content: The long-term financing dimension of cash management ________.

option1.content: deals with the selection, issuance, and management of long-term debt and equity

option2.content: is unaffected by currency changes because everyone borrows in U.S. dollars

option3.content: focuses on the analysis of investment opportunities

option4.content: is independent of the capital structure of an MNE

question.content: The financial management activity that determines the proper mix of debt and equity is ________.
The CFO’ s function in a company focuses on ________.
Acquiring and allocating financial resources among the company’ s activities and projects is the responsibility of the ________.
Which of the following is a primary task of international financial managers?

option1.content: raise funds for the firm through product marketing

option2.content: oversee cash-flow of the firm’ s value-adding activities

option4.content: determine the salaries of executives and personnel

question.content: A financial manager in an international company would most likely be responsible for all of the following activities except.
The concept of leveraging in finance refers to ________.

option1.content: the degree to which companies rely on foreign exchange to fund operations

option2.content: how a company hedges its foreign currency obligations

option3.content: the degree to which a firm funds the growth of a business by debt

option4.content: how much cash the CFO has in the bank

question.content: MNEs most likely use offshore debt markets ________.

option1.content: to hide their cash from tax authorities

option2.content: to take advantage of their ability to access capital in different countries

option3.content: since debt in foreign countries is always cheaper than in the home country market

option4.content: because investors don’ t like to invest in companies that only raise capital in their home markets

question.content: What is a Eurodollar?

option1.content: a euro held by an American

option2.content: a U.S. dollar deposited in a European bank

option3.content: a euro deposited in a U.S. bank.

option4.content: any currency deposited in a country other than the country of issue

question.content: Which of the following is NOT an advantage associated with Eurocurrencies?
Which of the following is most likely a benefit for firms that participate in the global capital market?

option4.content: quick sale of stocks and bonds

question.content: The global capital market offers all of the following advantages to firms except ________.
When using equity financing, firms run the risk of ________.

option1.content: losing a controlling interest to shareholders

option2.content: acquiring capital through the sale of shares

option3.content: incurring an unmanageable amount of debt

option4.content: falling victim to currency exchange rates

question.content: A bond issue floated by a U.S. company in dollars in London, Luxembourg, and Switzerland by a syndication of bonds is an example of a ________.
The international bond market is a major source of debt financing for which of the following?
Which of the following countries has the largest market for domestic bonds?
A bond that is issued by Nestle, a Swiss company, which is denominated in yen and sold to residents of Japan is most likely a ________.
A bond issued by a Brazilian company in British pounds in London is a ________.
Firms most likely borrow money in the international bond market to ________.

option1.content: guarantee high yields and low rates

option4.content: allow emerging markets to invest in foreign exchange

question.content: Brooke buys shares of stock in a small bakery in a foreign country in return for an ownership position and promised capital gains. This is an example of ________.
The best way for a Euroequity to get a listing in the United States is to issue a(n) ________.
When Sistema, a Russian company, issued a U.S. dollar stock offering in London, its shares were classified as a(n) ________.
The European Union is an example of ________ integration.
Which of the following statements most accurately describes the relationship between trading groups and MNEs?

option1.content: Trading groups have no influence on the size of the regional market.

option2.content: Regional trading groups can define the rules under which companies must operate within that region.

option3.content: Companies never need to change their organizational structure to take advantage of regional trading groups.

option4.content: Regional trading groups have no influence on an MNE’ s strategy since they operate worldwide.

question.content: Anderson Enterprises is a U.S. firm that manufactures light fixtures for commercial and residential consumers. Anderson is looking to expand internationally, so the firm should most likely ________.

option1.content: focus on developing new recruitment strategies and selection tests

option2.content: change their organizational structure to fit the norms of the foreign country

option3.content: disregard changes in trading groups because they have little effect on a company

option4.content: look to expand beyond the triad regions currently controlled by the top 500 MNEs

question.content: Baldani Manufacturing, an Italian firm, plans to expand into Asia. In order to take advantage of regional trading groups, Baldani will most likely need to change its ________.
Which of the following is NOT one of the regions included in the triad regions of the world?
Which of the following accurately identifies a difference between GATT and the WTO?

option1.content: GATT could enforce member compliance with agreements, but the WTO cannot.

option2.content: At its inception, GATT had more member nations than the WTO currently has.

option3.content: GATT withdrew the most-favored-nation clause, but the WTO reinstated it.

option4.content: GATT rules did not cover trade in services, but the rules of the WTO do.

question.content: Under the WTO agreement, ________.

option1.content: a dispute resolution mechanism allows countries to bring grievances to the WTO against countries that levy inappropriate trade discrimination measures

option2.content: there is no dispute resolution mechanism except for trade involving environmental products

option3.content: countries are allowed to place trade barriers on member countries with no particular justification, because like GATT the WTO has no enforcement mechanism

option4.content: tariffs are permitted to be levied by developed countries against developing countries but not against each other

question.content: A major problem with the Doha Round is that ________.

option1.content: developing countries want developed countries to better protect their intellectual property

option2.content: developing countries want a reduction in agricultural subsidies maintained by the developed countries

option3.content: the WTO does not want the developing countries to liberalize their investment rules

option4.content: because of security issues, not all countries were able to attend the meetings, so it was impossible to get a consensus vote

question.content: Which of the following groups of countries is most likely to form a regional trading group?
The 27 member EU negotiates trade agreements as one. The EU and Brazil have negotiated a strategic trade alliance which is an example of a ________.
Of the following possibilities, the European Union is best described as a ________.
Trade shifting to countries within a regional trade agreement at the expense of trade with countries not in the agreement is called ________.
When the European Union was formed, the size of the market increased for European companies. This is most likely an example of a ________.
Since production has shifted to more efficient producers due to comparative advantage, consumers in Country X have had access to more goods at lower prices. Which of the following most likely exists?
A free trade agreement is likely to increase efficiency because of ________.

Assume that U.S. companies are importing the same product from Mexico and Taiwan. The United States enters into an FTA with Mexico but not with Taiwan. Consequently, the United States begins to import more goods from Mexico (due to lower tariffs) than from Taiwan, even though the Mexican products are not any better or cheaper. This is most likely an example of ________.
The ________ is the European Union’ s ultimate decision-making body and is composed of the different ministers of the member countries.
The three major responsibilities of the ________ are legislative power, control over the budget, and supervision of executive decisions.
The EU organization that provides political leadership, drafts laws, and runs the daily programs of the EU is the ________.
The EU organization that ensures consistent interpretation and application of EU treaties is the ________.
Which of the following was primarily responsible for establishing the euro?
Critics of the Lisbon Treaty primarily argue that the legislation will ________.
Hudson Manufacturing is an MNE based in the U.S. with operations in Asia. The firm is considering expansion into the European Union. Which of the following questions is most relevant to the decision?

option1.content: What is the primary language of most workers?

option2.content: Which country has the best production location?

option3.content: Which currency has the most favorable value of the euro?

option4.content: Which country has the lowest tariffs for manufactured products?

question.content: Korman Industries is a foreign multinational that recently established operations in the European Union. What is the most likely advantage for Korman as a result?

option1.content: Governance processes are streamlined because local governments have been eliminated.

option2.content: Market size is larger because of the elimination of internal tariff barriers.

option3.content: Differential external tariff barriers exist for product shipments.

option4.content: The EU uses English as its official language.

question.content: Which of the following recently threatened the future of the EU’ s common currency?

option1.content: refusal of the UK to use the euro

question.content: NAFTA was primarily formed because the member nations have ________.
NAFTA is a good example of ________.
Compared to the European Union, the North American Free Trade Agreement ________.

option1.content: has a stronger currency linkage due to the U.S. dollar

option2.content: has more trade problems since it is a customs union

option3.content: is significantly larger in population and total GNI

option4.content: is slightly smaller in population and GDP

question.content: Under NAFTA, rules of origin ensure that ________.

option1.content: only goods produced mostly within the region are eligible for liberal tariff conditions

option2.content: only American products are shipped to Canada and Mexico duty-free

option3.content: all members import products only from member nations

option4.content: all members have the same external and internal tariffs

question.content: Which of the following is a unique provision of NAFTA?
Which of the following is the primary focus of the African Union (AU)?
Commodity agreements ________.

option1.content: were initially established to attempt to stabilize commodity prices

option2.content: are effective in regulating the price of grains but not minerals

option3.content: are effective in regulating the prices of both grains and minerals

option4.content: were disbanded by the United Nations for being non-competitive

question.content: The role of most commodity agreements now is to ________.

option1.content: discuss issues and disseminate information about commodities

option2.content: keep consumer countries from controlling commodity prices

option3.content: allow producer countries to control inflation by keeping commodity prices low

option4.content: stabilize prices through regional alliances between producer and consumer countries

question.content: An example of an effective commodity agreement is ________.

option1.content: the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries

option2.content: the Organization of Petroleum Importing Countries

question.content: The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries ________.

option1.content: uses import tariffs to control oil prices

option3.content: uses quotas to control oil prices

option4.content: produces all of the world’ s oil

question.content: Which of the following primarily triggered Toyota’ s investment in the European Union?

option1.content: Europeans demanded affordable, high quality cars from Japan.

option2.content: A common currency gave Europeans more buying power.

option3.content: The EU lowered trade barriers on foreign auto imports.

option4.content: Japan and the EU formed a free trade agreement.

question.content: Which of the following is Walmart’ s competitive advantage in Mexico?

option1.content: Walmart purchased all Mexican retail chains and eliminated competitors.

option2.content: Walmart is able to transfer its "everyday low prices" concept to Mexico.

option3.content: Walmart offers affordable, unique products for niche markets in Mexico.

option4.content: Customers prefer to buy from American companies instead of Mexican companies.

question.content: What was the primary purpose of the formation of Sinergia?

option3.content: better compete with Walmart on price

option4.content: include Walmart in the regional supply chain

question.content: Which of the following is most likely a true statement about the relationship between the United Nations and NGOs?

option1.content: The UN must license an NGO for it to be involved in any international relief efforts.

option2.content: A UN committee discusses issues of importance to NGOs but does not regulate their activities.

option3.content: The UN determines which NGOs can work on international humanitarian issues and relief efforts.

option4.content: NGOs typically operate in only one country, whereas UN agencies can operate anywhere in the world.

question.content: Hudson Manufacturing is an MNE based in the U.S. with operations in Asia. The firm is considering expansion into the European Union. Executives at the firm are debating whether central Europe or Eastern Europe would be best for the firm. Which of the following best supports a decision to establish operations in Eastern Europe?

option1.content: Hudson wants to implement a high-performance work system.

option2.content: Hudson plans to staff the foreign facility with local managers.

option3.content: Hudson wants to minimize costs by keeping wages low.

option4.content: Hudson recently lost money in a joint venture.

question.content: The view that globalization is inevitable is most likely based on the belief that ________.

option2.content: protesters against globalization will be persuaded to change their views

option3.content: people want more global homogeneity of cultures

option4.content: technical advances in transportation and communications are highly persistent

question.content: Critics of the view that regionalization will prevail over globalization most likely base their argument on the belief that ________.

option1.content: regionalization is a transition stage toward globalization

option2.content: neighboring countries are more apt to disagree politically than distant countries

option3.content: neighboring countries are too geographically similar to benefit from trade

option4.content: business in non-territorial areas is not regional

question.content: Which of the following is NOT a common argument for the slowing of future globalization?

option1.content: Antiglobalization interests have been successful in electing parties that oppose freer movement of trade or people.

option2.content: Technological, transportation, and communication advances will decline in the near future.

option3.content: Major countries have either ignored certain international treaties or have refused to sign them.

option4.content: The growing split between those who succeed in a global environment and those who do not will foster greater antiglobalization sentiments.

question.content: Assume that company executives at the firm would like to increase sales by expanding into an international market. Which of the following factors, if true, best supports a decision to expand sales globally?

option1.content: It can offshore most of its production.

option2.content: It can obtain all of its resources for the same price overseas.

option3.content: Its costs of making additional sales would not increase disproportionately.

option4.content: The foreign market has higher real interest rates.

question.content: Which of the following is the LEAST likely reason that small countries worry about overdependence caused by globalization?

option1.content: A large country on which they depend may pressure them on political matters.

option2.content: A large international firm may dictate its terms of operations in a small country.

option3.content: A large company may exploit legal loopholes to avoid tax payments.

option4.content: A large country may substantially increase its demand for the small country’ s production.

question.content: Which of the following statements would most likely be made by a SUPPORTER of globalization?

option1.content: Globalization encourages the adoption of uniform and superior standards for combating environmental problems.

option2.content: Economic growth created by globalization is largely in services, which involves the use of few nonrenewable resources.

option3.content: Global competition discourages resource-saving technologies, which are costly.

option4.content: Air pollution and toxic runoff problems increase with global economic growth.

question.content: Limitation of logging in the Amazon region is generally viewed as environmentally beneficial for the planet as a whole; however, unemployed Brazilian workers have felt that job creation inside Brazil is more important than climate protection outside Brazil. This example best illustrates which of the following?

option1.content: why smaller countries are concerned that large international companies are powerful enough to dictate operating terms

option2.content: why globalization is needed to foster uniform standards for combating environmental problems

option3.content: how cultural homogeneity threatens the cultural foundation of smaller nations

option4.content: how global interests can conflict with a country’ s local interests

question.content: Although globalization may bring economic growth, critics nevertheless contend that ________.

option2.content: the inequality of gains puts some people in a relatively worse economic situation

option3.content: this growth is mainly for the future, thus ignoring present economic growth needs

option4.content: the cultural foundations of sovereignty are supported by globalization

question.content: Assume an enterprise is considering establishment of a foreign production facility. Which of the following best supports this decision?

option1.content: Its foreign competitors have higher production costs than it has.

option2.content: Its main competitor successfully opened a foreign plant.

option3.content: Its suppliers follow an agglomeration strategy.

option4.content: None of its competitors have foreign production facilities.

question.content: Phineas compares the innovative features of his company’ s water filters with those already sold in the local market. He believes his filters have great potential because they are functionally superior, have a longer lifespan, and can be priced more competitively than other sellers in the local market. The innovative feature of Phineas’{} product that will help in wide acceptance of his product in the local market is its...
From the point of view of innovative characteristics, a product is considered compatible if

option1.content: the degree of social consequences associated with this is high

option2.content: its benefits can be easily communicated

option3.content: this is consistent with accepted behaviour, values and norms of the local market

option4.content: it has a higher degree of complexity compared to its counterparts

question.content: Karin, who is interested in promoting her company’ s nutritional products in Asia, studies acceptable behavior, norms and values in Asian markets as they apply to her product. In other words, Karin is exploring _________ of her product in Asian markets.
A company that is focusing its efforts on making its new innovation more user-friendly than before is working on _______ product.

Maya was happy that she didn’ t have to read the instruction manual to figure out how to turn on her new camera, take a digital photo, and export it to her computer. The signs (symbols) on the camera body made it very clear what she had to do to succeed in digital photography. Which feature of Maya’ s "new product" makes it easy for her to start her digital experience?

An American company wants to launch a new product in Madrid. Freda asks her product manager to give out some samples to potential customers so she can gauge consumer preferences before introducing the product. Freda is trying to reduce the degree of economic and/or social risk, also known as ________, associated with the use of the product.
The __________ of a product refers to the ease with which its benefits can be communicated to customers.
In general, the degree of market acceptance or resistance to a product is negatively related to...
Which factor is primarily responsible for perceptual bias in the interpretation of product characteristics?

option1.content: too much information about the product

option3.content: self-assessment criterion for a market analyst

option4.content: a small number of product competitors

question.content: The success achieved by firms in bringing their inventions to market is called -
The product platform, design features, and functionality are all contained within the _______ component of the physical product according to the product component model.
Dry cleaning, hair styling and hotel stays have intrinsic value,
resulting from a process, performance, or event that exists only at the time of its creation. What service characteristics are we talking about here?
What are the United States’{} largest service exports, second only to capital goods and industrial supplies, when all exports are included?
How do the vast majority of services enter the foreign market?
What barrier does consumer services marketers face when a foreign market imposes a tariff on a service that operates there?

option1.content: no restrictions on cross-border data flows

question.content: Blue Lobster was considering opening restaurants in China. However, the restaurant union felt that since accepting tips from waiters is considered bad manners in China, they would face a significant loss of income. So they demanded to know how employees would be compensated for this, since most of a typical service employee’ s compensation comes in the form of tips. What obstacle does the consumer services marketer face in this illustration?
Industrial markets differ from consumer markets in that...

option1.content: the market for industrial goods is insignificant compared to the market for consumer goods

option2.content: demand for industrial goods is more volatile than demand for consumer goods

option3.content: industrial goods are sold domestically, while consumer goods are sold internationally

option4.content: industrial goods are always more expensive than consumer goods

question.content: Which statement is true for industrial markets?

option2.content: Industrial sellers typically have a small number of buyers on whom they are more dependent

option3.content: Derived demand does not affect markets

option4.content: Sales of industrial goods are stable and do not fluctuate

question.content: Which factor increases demand volatility in industrial markets?

option1.content: Demand for industrial goods does not depend on changes in economic development

option2.content: Professional buyers in the industrial market tend to act in concert

option3.content: Small non-cyclical fluctuations in demand are inherent in industrial markets

option4.content: Savvy buyers tend to make purchasing decisions on their own

question.content: For managers selling capital equipment and high-value industrial services, understanding the concept of ________ is absolutely fundamental to their success.
Derived demand can be defined as demand that

option4.content: regardless of the desires and needs of consumers

question.content: What can be used as a measure to manage volatility in industrial demand?

option4.content: avoidance of investments in foreign high-yield financial instruments

question.content: Why do German and Japanese firms tend to do better than American firms when it comes to managing volatility?

option1.content: Their emphasis is on beating the competition

option3.content: They value employees and stability more highly

option4.content: They lower prices faster and increase advertising costs during booms

question.content: What is perhaps the most significant environmental factor affecting the international market for industrial goods and services?
What is perhaps the best indicator of a country’ s ability to use technology to move through multiple stages of economic development in a very short time?
Which trend is driving the demand for technologically advanced products in the world?

option1.content: increase in the number of unskilled labor in the world

option2.content: expanding economic and industrial growth in Asia

option3.content: large budget deficit in developed countries

question.content: Which trend will lead to increased demand for manufactured goods and business services in Latin America?

option1.content: increase in import tariff by 70 percent

option4.content: increased use of labor instead of capital in production

question.content: What determines the perception of quality?
An important aspect of quality is how good the product is

option3.content: meets the specific needs of the buyer

question.content: The total quality management ( TQM ) process begins with

option1.content: providing all customers with technologically advanced products

option2.content: involving customers in the product development process

option3.content: signing trade agreements with developed countries

option4.content: reducing the time required to bring a product to market

question.content: Which statement is true regarding universal standards when selling international products?

option1.content: The idea of universal standards is resisted in developing countries

option2.content: Firms that adhere to universal standards believe that costs exceed benefits

option3.content: The international market for manufactured goods uses the imperial system as a universal standard

option4.content: Lack of universal standards limits the expansion of industries

question.content: The Global Harmonization Task Force is an international organization that is trying to...

option1.content: promote free trade between developing and developed countries

option3.content: coordinate standards for several international industrial sectors

option4.content: increase double testing of goods and services

question.content: Buyers in country X prefer to use the older, cheaper version of the product from company A , even though it is bulkier and less convenient to use. Buyers in country Y , however, prefer to use the newer, lighter version for its new user interface. Which statement is the most accurate conclusion from the information given?

option1.content: Company A needs to update its after-sales service

option2.content: Perception of quality may vary between countries

option3.content: Sales of manufactured goods in country X are higher than in country Y

option4.content: Country X is a highly industrialized country

question.content: The US Congress and businesses are resisting the metric system because they are afraid...

option1.content: market competition from international firms already using the metric system

option2.content: it will be too expensive to implement

option3.content: negative consumer reaction and replacement of international products

question.content: Lack of universal standards in the industrial goods market...

option2.content: gives each firm a competitive advantage

option3.content: increases the cost of doing business

question.content: Which of the following countries is not officially on the metric system?
The American Customer Satisfaction Index ( ACSI ) focuses on...

option1.content: product differentiation based on its quality

option2.content: evaluation of a company’ s quality based on its leadership, strategic planning, and customer and market focus

option3.content: quality perceived by users of products and services

option4.content: audit of company business processes to ensure quality

question.content: ________ is quickly becoming the primary after-sales service for the sale of technical products in countries where the latest technology is required.

In a _________ distribution structure, the importer controls a fixed inventory of goods, and the marketing system develops around the philosophy of selling a limited number of goods at high prices to a small number of wealthy customers.
Which distribution structure is also known as traditional distribution structure?
Allocation to _________ has long been considered the most effective non-tariff barrier in this market.
Which group is considered the basis of the Japanese distribution system?
What feature characterizes the business philosophy of Japanese distribution channels?
In Japan, under the Large-Scale Retail Store Law, all proposals for new ‘‘large-scale’’ stores were first evaluated...

option2.content: Ministry of International Trade and Industry

option3.content: Council on Internal Affairs and Business Affairs

question.content: What makes Walmart’ s supplier operations highly efficient and reduces transaction costs?

option3.content: internal Internet system for interaction with suppliers

option4.content: outreach programs to reassure small retailers

question.content: General Motors , ________, DaimlerChrysler and DaimlerChrysler have created a single online site called Covisint for purchasing auto parts from suppliers.
